00063 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_script_paths_doc,
00064 ".. function:: script_paths()\n"
00065 "\n"
00066 "   Return 2 paths to blender scripts directories.\n"
00067 "\n"
00068 "   :return: (system, user) strings will be empty when not found.\n"
00069 "   :rtype: tuple of strings\n"
00070 );
00071 static PyObject *bpy_script_paths(PyObject *UNUSED(self))
00072 {
00073     PyObject *ret = PyTuple_New(2);
00074     PyObject *item;
00075     char *path;
00076 
00077     path = BLI_get_folder(BLENDER_SYSTEM_SCRIPTS, NULL);
00078     item = PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefault(path ? path : "");
00079     BLI_assert(item != NULL);
00080     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0, item);
00081     path = BLI_get_folder(BLENDER_USER_SCRIPTS, NULL);
00082     item = PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefault(path ? path : "");
00083     BLI_assert(item != NULL);
00084     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1, item);
00085 
00086     return ret;
00087 }
00088 
00089 static int bpy_blend_paths_visit_cb(void *userdata, char *UNUSED(path_dst), const char *path_src)
00090 {
00091     PyObject *list = (PyObject *)userdata;
00092     PyObject *item = PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefault(path_src);
00093     PyList_Append(list, item);
00094     Py_DECREF(item);
00095     return FALSE; /* never edits the path */
00096 }
00097 
00098 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_blend_paths_doc,
00099 ".. function:: blend_paths(absolute=False, packed=False, local=False)\n"
00100 "\n"
00101 "   Returns a list of paths to external files referenced by the loaded .blend file.\n"
00102 "\n"
00103 "   :arg absolute: When true the paths returned are made absolute.\n"
00104 "   :type absolute: boolean\n"
00105 "   :arg packed: When true skip file paths for packed data.\n"
00106 "   :type packed: boolean\n"
00107 "   :arg local: When true skip linked library paths.\n"
00108 "   :type local: boolean\n"
00109 "   :return: path list.\n"
00110 "   :rtype: list of strings\n"
00111 );
00112 static PyObject *bpy_blend_paths(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args, PyObject *kw)
00113 {
00114     int flag = 0;
00115     PyObject *list;
00116 
00117     int absolute = FALSE;
00118     int packed =   FALSE;
00119     int local =    FALSE;
00120     static const char *kwlist[] = {"absolute", "packed", "local", NULL};
00121 
00122     if (!PyArg_ParseTupleAndKeywords(args, kw, "|ii:blend_paths",
00123                                      (char **)kwlist, &absolute, &packed))
00124     {
00125         return NULL;
00126     }
00127 
00128     if (absolute) flag |= BPATH_TRAVERSE_ABS;
00129     if (!packed)  flag |= BPATH_TRAVERSE_SKIP_PACKED;
00130     if (local)    flag |= BPATH_TRAVERSE_SKIP_LIBRARY;
00131 
00132     list = PyList_New(0);
00133 
00134     bpath_traverse_main(G.main, bpy_blend_paths_visit_cb, flag, (void *)list);
00135 
00136     return list;
00137 }

00140 // PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_user_resource_doc[] = // now in bpy/utils.py
00141 static PyObject *bpy_user_resource(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args, PyObject *kw)
00142 {
00143     char *type;
00144     char *subdir = NULL;
00145     int folder_id;
00146     static const char *kwlist[] = {"type", "subdir", NULL};
00147 
00148     char *path;
00149 
00150     if (!PyArg_ParseTupleAndKeywords(args, kw, "s|s:user_resource", (char **)kwlist, &type, &subdir))
00151         return NULL;
00152     
00153     /* stupid string compare */
00154     if      (!strcmp(type, "DATAFILES")) folder_id = BLENDER_USER_DATAFILES;
00155     else if (!strcmp(type, "CONFIG"))    folder_id = BLENDER_USER_CONFIG;
00156     else if (!strcmp(type, "SCRIPTS"))   folder_id = BLENDER_USER_SCRIPTS;
00157     else if (!strcmp(type, "AUTOSAVE"))  folder_id = BLENDER_USER_AUTOSAVE;
00158     else {
00159         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "invalid resource argument");
00160         return NULL;
00161     }
00162     
00163     /* same logic as BLI_get_folder_create(), but best leave it up to the script author to create */
00164     path = BLI_get_folder(folder_id, subdir);
00165 
00166     if (!path)
00167         path = BLI_get_user_folder_notest(folder_id, subdir);
00168 
00169     return PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefault(path ? path : "");
00170 }

00172 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_resource_path_doc,
00173 ".. function:: resource_path(type, major=2, minor=57)\n"
00174 "\n"
00175 "   Return the base path for storing system files.\n"
00176 "\n"
00177 "   :arg type: string in ['USER', 'LOCAL', 'SYSTEM'].\n"
00178 "   :type type: string\n"
00179 "   :arg major: major version, defaults to current.\n"
00180 "   :type major: int\n"
00181 "   :arg minor: minor version, defaults to current.\n"
00182 "   :type minor: string\n"
00183 "   :return: the resource path (not necessarily existing).\n"
00184 "   :rtype: string\n"
00185 );
00186 static PyObject *bpy_resource_path(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args, PyObject *kw)
00187 {
00188     char *type;
00189     int major = BLENDER_VERSION / 100, minor = BLENDER_VERSION % 100;
00190     static const char *kwlist[] = {"type", "major", "minor", NULL};
00191     int folder_id;
00192     char *path;
00193 
00194     if (!PyArg_ParseTupleAndKeywords(args, kw, "s|ii:resource_path", (char **)kwlist, &type, &major, &minor))
00195         return NULL;
00196 
00197     /* stupid string compare */
00198     if      (!strcmp(type, "USER"))    folder_id = BLENDER_RESOURCE_PATH_USER;
00199     else if (!strcmp(type, "LOCAL"))   folder_id = BLENDER_RESOURCE_PATH_LOCAL;
00200     else if (!strcmp(type, "SYSTEM"))  folder_id = BLENDER_RESOURCE_PATH_SYSTEM;
00201     else {
00202         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "invalid resource argument");
00203         return NULL;
00204     }
00205 
00206     path = BLI_get_folder_version(folder_id, (major * 100) + minor, FALSE);
00207 
00208     return PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefault(path ? path : "");
00209 }

00211 static PyMethodDef meth_bpy_script_paths =
00212     {"script_paths", (PyCFunction)bpy_script_paths, METH_NOARGS, bpy_script_paths_doc};
00213 static PyMethodDef meth_bpy_blend_paths =
00214     {"blend_paths", (PyCFunction)bpy_blend_paths, METH_VARARGS | METH_KEYWORDS, bpy_blend_paths_doc};
00215 static PyMethodDef meth_bpy_user_resource =
00216     {"user_resource", (PyCFunction)bpy_user_resource, METH_VARARGS | METH_KEYWORDS, NULL};
00217 static PyMethodDef meth_bpy_resource_path =
00218     {"resource_path", (PyCFunction)bpy_resource_path, METH_VARARGS | METH_KEYWORDS, bpy_resource_path_doc};

00221 static PyObject *bpy_import_test(const char *modname)
00222 {
00223     PyObject *mod = PyImport_ImportModuleLevel((char *)modname, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
00224     if (mod) {
00225         Py_DECREF(mod);
00226     }
00227     else {
00228         PyErr_Print();
00229         PyErr_Clear();
00230     }
00231 
00232     return mod;
00233 }

00235 /******************************************************************************
00236  * Description: Creates the bpy module and adds it to sys.modules for importing
00237  ******************************************************************************/
00238 void BPy_init_modules(void)
00239 {
00240     extern BPy_StructRNA *bpy_context_module;
00241     extern int bpy_lib_init(PyObject *);
00242     PointerRNA ctx_ptr;
00243     PyObject *mod;
00244 
00245     /* Needs to be first since this dir is needed for future modules */
00246     char *modpath = BLI_get_folder(BLENDER_SYSTEM_SCRIPTS, "modules");
00247     if (modpath) {
00248         // printf("bpy: found module path '%s'.\n", modpath);
00249         PyObject *sys_path = PySys_GetObject("path"); /* borrow */
00250         PyObject *py_modpath = PyUnicode_FromString(modpath);
00251         PyList_Insert(sys_path, 0, py_modpath); /* add first */
00252         Py_DECREF(py_modpath);
00253     }
00254     else {
00255         printf("bpy: couldnt find 'scripts/modules', blender probably wont start.\n");
00256     }
00257     /* stand alone utility modules not related to blender directly */
00258     IDProp_Init_Types(); /* not actually a submodule, just types */
00259 
00260     mod = PyModule_New("_bpy");
00261 
00262     /* add the module so we can import it */
00263     PyDict_SetItemString(PyImport_GetModuleDict(), "_bpy", mod);
00264     Py_DECREF(mod);
00265 
00266     /* run first, initializes rna types */
00267     BPY_rna_init();
00268 
00269     /* needs to be first so bpy_types can run */
00270     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "types", BPY_rna_types());
00271 
00272     /* metaclass for idprop types, bpy_types.py needs access */
00273     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "StructMetaPropGroup", (PyObject *)&pyrna_struct_meta_idprop_Type);
00274 
00275     /* needs to be first so bpy_types can run */
00276     bpy_lib_init(mod);
00277 
00278     bpy_import_test("bpy_types");
00279     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "data", BPY_rna_module()); /* imports bpy_types by running this */
00280     bpy_import_test("bpy_types");
00281     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "props", BPY_rna_props());  
00282     /* ops is now a python module that does the conversion from SOME_OT_foo -> some.foo */
00283     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "ops", BPY_operator_module());
00284     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "app", BPY_app_struct());
00285 
00286     /* bpy context */
00287     RNA_pointer_create(NULL, &RNA_Context, (void *)BPy_GetContext(), &ctx_ptr);
00288     bpy_context_module = (BPy_StructRNA *)pyrna_struct_CreatePyObject(&ctx_ptr);
00289     /* odd that this is needed, 1 ref on creation and another for the module
00290      * but without we get a crash on exit */
00291     Py_INCREF(bpy_context_module);
00292 
00293     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "context", (PyObject *)bpy_context_module);
00294 
00295     /* utility func's that have nowhere else to go */
00296     PyModule_AddObject(mod, meth_bpy_script_paths.ml_name, (PyObject *)PyCFunction_New(&meth_bpy_script_paths, NULL));
00297     PyModule_AddObject(mod, meth_bpy_blend_paths.ml_name, (PyObject *)PyCFunction_New(&meth_bpy_blend_paths, NULL));
00298     PyModule_AddObject(mod, meth_bpy_user_resource.ml_name, (PyObject *)PyCFunction_New(&meth_bpy_user_resource, NULL));
00299     PyModule_AddObject(mod, meth_bpy_resource_path.ml_name, (PyObject *)PyCFunction_New(&meth_bpy_resource_path, NULL));
00300 
00301     /* register funcs (bpy_rna.c) */
00302     PyModule_AddObject(mod, meth_bpy_register_class.ml_name, (PyObject *)PyCFunction_New(&meth_bpy_register_class, NULL));
00303     PyModule_AddObject(mod, meth_bpy_unregister_class.ml_name, (PyObject *)PyCFunction_New(&meth_bpy_unregister_class, NULL));
00304 
00305     /* add our own modules dir, this is a python package */
00306     bpy_package_py = bpy_import_test("bpy");
00307 }
